title: Retroid Pocket 6 launch hits another stumbling block after shipping delayed
summary: Retroidโs latest update suggests the Pocket 6 rollout will take a little longer than planned.
body: Credit: X/@Retroid0fficial TL;DR Retroid says early Pocket 6 shipments will be limited after OLED screen production slowed things down. Only around 100 black units are expected to ship first, with wider shipments starting later in the week. The update follows the Pocket 6โs recent redesign, which reintroduced the handheld with two control layouts. It hasnโt been smooth sailing for Retroid over the last couple of months. After relaunching the Pocket 6 with two different control layouts, early shipments of the Android handheld are now being staggered thanks to a production slowdown tied to its OLED screen. In a Discord update to customers, the company said it will only be able to ship around 100 black Pocket 6 units next Monday, starting with the stick-on-top version. Retroid says the holdup comes down to OLED screen calibration, which has limited how many units it can get out the door during early production.

body: Valentino Garavani, the jet-set Italian designer whose high-glamour gowns โ often in his trademark shade of โValentino redโ โ were fashion show staples for nearly half a century, has died at home in Rome, his foundation announced Monday (Jan. 19). He was 93. โValentino Garavani was not only a constant guide and inspiration for all of us, but a true source of light, creativity and vision,” the foundation said in a statement posted on social media. The funeral will be held Friday at the Basilica Santa Maria degli Angeli e dei Martiri in Romeโs Piazza della Repubblica. Universally known by his first name, Valentino was adored by generations of royals, first ladies and movie stars, from Jackie Kennedy Onassis to Julia Roberts and Queen Rania of Jordan, who swore the designer always made them look and feel their best. โI know what women want,โ he once rโฆ

title: Google Calendar is making it harder to lose track of all your multiple calendars
summary: A switch that makes calendar ownership harder to ignore.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google Calendar will now always show any secondary calendars you own in your Settings list. The change builds on last yearโs move to give every secondary calendar a dedicated owner. The rollout starts today for personal accounts and on January 27 for Workspace users. Itโs pretty easy to create a secondary calendar in Google Calendar and then completely forget about it, but Google is stepping in to tidy things up. The company is rolling out a change that ensures any secondary calendars you own will always appear in your calendar list in Settings, making them easier to find and manage. Detailed in a Google Workspace Update , this move builds on a change Google introduced late last year, when it moved secondary calendars to a dedicated ownership model. Under that system, every secondary calendar has a single owner whoโs responsible for its settings, permissions, and lifecycle. The new update closes a practical gap in that setup by ensuring ownership is visible.

The screen itself is around the same size as the budget Pocket AIR Miniโs 4.2-inch LCD display, although this handheld is much, much more powerful.

title: Was 2025 Tyler, The Creatorโs Greatest Pop Star YearยYet?

body: This podcast episode is part of the Billboard editorial staff’s Greatest Pop Stars of 2025 list. Find our accompanying Tyler essay here , and all the rest of our essays and podcasts related to the list here . Tyler, The Creator had a big enough 2024 to end up an honorable mention on our Greatest Pop Stars Honorable Mentions list that year, with his October release Chromakopia landing the best first-week numbers of his career and spawning multiple top 10 Hot 100 hits, including his first long-lasting rap radio hit “Sticky.” But rather than spend 2025 basking in the afterglow of that success, Tyler just kept pushing forward last year, with a dancefloor-oriented semi-surprise new album, one of the year’s biggest tours and even a feature film debut in one of the year’s biggest movies. This Greatest Pop Stars of 2025 episode of the  Greatest Pop Stars  podcast  looks at how Tyler, The Creator ended up at No. 10 on our list โ his first time making the top 10 โ thanks to an impressively full year where he really decided to just go for it. body: For this yearโs update of our ongoing  Greatest Pop Star by Year  project,  Billboard  will be counting down our editorial staff picks for the 10  Greatest Pop Stars of 2025 all the next two weeks. Now, we kick off our top 10 with an artist who kept the pedal to the floor for 2025, trying new sounds and new mediums and ending up more ubiquitous than ever: Tyler, The Creator. The rabble-rousers of Odd Future took their off-color, Tumblr-coded rap music to network television โ and their appearance marked their introduction to the mainstream.  But at the time, and for years after, Odd Future’s ringleader and breakout talent, Tyler, The Creator , seemed an unlikelโฆ

title: Hereโs how I keep my NAS safe from prying eyes
summary: From disabling default accounts to reverse proxies and immutable backups, this is how I protect my home server.
body: Network Attached Storage devices are all the rage these days, but Iโve been using them for well over a decade at this point. Iโve got multiple boxes sitting on a shelf in my study, holding backups, family photos, my ever-expanding library of media, while also acting as my home server. Itโs easy to assume that just because the box is sitting in my home or desk, itโs perfectly safe. I used to think that as long as thereโs no unauthorised access to my home internet network, I shouldnโt have anything to worry about. Turns out, I was wrong. Learning how to harden your NAS can be annoying, but it pays off in peace of mind. You see, a modern NAS is not just a hard drive with a network cable; it is a fully functional server. Once you start enabling features that make a NAS useful, like remote streaming or file sharing, you are effectively opening it up to wide open internet and that means its time for you to start acting as your own IT department. The moment remote access enters the picture, your local-first device becomes a prime target for anyone with an internet connection and bad intentions. Here is how I learned to harden my NAS and why I treat it like the most vulnerable device in mโฆ

title: Lime Cordiale Announce Climate-Focused Lime GreenยFestival
summary: Lime Cordiale brothers Oli and Louis Leimbach said the project emerged from years of questioning the environmental impact of touring and live events.
body: Australian indie favourites Lime Cordiale have announced a new climate-focused live music event, unveiling the inaugural Lime Green Festival, a one-day, off-grid festival designed to place environmental action at the centre of the live music experience. Set to take place on April 18 at Point Malcolm Reserve in Semaphore, Adelaide, the festival is being presented in partnership with Chugg Music and supported by the South Australian Government and City of Charles Sturt. According to organisers, Lime Green is being developed as a 100% off-grid event, with the goal of significantly reducing the environmental footprint typically associated with large-scale live music festivals. Lime Cordiale brothers Oli and Louis Leimbach said the project emerged from years of questioning the environmental impact of touring and live events. โFrom the accelerating loss of polar ice to the devastating algal blooms currently choking the South Australian coast, it is impossible to ignore that our climate is at a breaking point,โ the duo said in a statement. โFor the last five years, weโve wrestled with a deep, personal dilemma as environmentalists: Is our touring contributing to the problem? Does it stillโฆ

title: Itโs been 8 years of phone AI chips โ and theyโre still wasting their potential

body: Itโs been a little over eight years since we first started talking about Neural Processing Units (NPUs) inside our smartphones and the early prospects of on-device AI. Big points if you remember that the HUAWEI Mate 10โs Kirin 970 processor was the first, though similar ideas had been floating around, particularly in imaging, before then. Of course, a lot has changed in the last eight years โ Apple has finally embraced AI, albeit with mixed results, and Google has obviously leaned heavily into its Tensor Processor Unit for everything from imaging to on-device language translation. Ask any of the big tech companies, from Arm and Qualcomm to Apple and Samsung, and theyโll all tell you that AI is the future of smartphone hardware and software.

body: Credit: Paul Jones / Android Authority Iโve gone hands-on with a variety of flagship Android phones in recent years, including devices from Google, Samsung, Xiaomi, and vivo. However, Iโve noticed a growing trend in the last couple of years thatโs only picked up more steam in the last six months. Iโm talking about the fact that phones like the Pixel 10 series , Samsung Galaxy S25 , and OnePlus 15 all feel like iPhones. And Iโm really sick of this lazy approach to smartphone design.

title: The biggest problem with the Galaxy Z TriFold is its size โ but not in the way you might think
summary: It's too big for a smartphone, but too small for its real purpose.
body: Thereโs something about foldable phones that reignites that childhood excitement within me. When I first set eyes on the original Galaxy Fold nearly a decade ago, I was awestruck that a tablet-sized screen could actually fold over and fit within my pocket. I didnโt quite believe that the technology would be so pervasive years later, and such is the speed of technology, a screen that folds just once isnโt enough anymore. Before the end of the year, Samsung announced the Galaxy Z TriFold . Itโs the latest phone to compress a small tablet into a candy-bar form factor, but while this larger, multifolding device is impressive as a technological achievement, in practice, Samsung couldโve and perhaps shouldโve offered consumers more.

title: Iโve used Nest Hubs for years. Googleโs next display needs these 5 upgrades, or Iโm out
summary: Google is teasing new smart displays, and a Nest Hub refresh couldn't come soon enough.
body: In the early days of the smart home ecosystem wars, I invested in a Google Home Hub to control lights and interact with the Google Assistant. A lot has changed since then; my smart display still sits on my desk, but itโs now called the Nest Hub and uses Gemini as its voice assistant . Iโve added a larger Nest Hub Max in my kitchen, and despite loving both displays, Google has given me little reason to upgrade. The standard Nest Hub hasnโt received an upgrade since 2021, and the Nest Hub Max hasnโt been refreshed since its original 2019 launch. For years, it felt like Google had forgotten about Nest users, but 2025 changed everything. We finally received new Nest hardware and a preview of the upcoming Google Home Speaker, along with an encouraging confirmation that Google remains committed to smart displays .

But over seven years later, the focus on one-handed use feels like an afterthought, especially with the latest One UI 8.5 beta . What made One UI different? title: Google might have solved my biggest issue with Pixel battery life
summary: Seven years of updates might be feasible with a new battery every couple of years.
body: On January 1, 2026, Google filed a patent (via Hypertxt.ai ) for an interesting smartphone battery design that skips glue and opts for a more mechanical way of locking the battery inside a phone using a rigid metal chassis. That new design should technically allow a normal user, like me, to dislodge the battery from the phone without puncturing it or damaging it, and replace it with a new one. Although this is still a patent, and patents have a tendency to remain theoretical hogwash, thereโs actually a reason why this particular one might end up in an actual product like the Pixel 12: the European Unionโs battery regulation . And if it does, then Google might have finally figured out how to fix one of the Pixelโs biggest battery complaints.

While many browsers โ such as Edge, Firefox, Arc, and Vivaldi โ support vertical tabs, Google Chrome has long been missing from the vertical tab bandwagon. But at long last, thatโs finally changing; vertical tabs have arrived in Chrome !

body: The GT7 Pro was a rather confusing release for realme. The brand was clearly trying to walk a fine line between a premium and affordable flagship experience. Yes, there was the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, a 3x 50MP camera, and a great screen. But the phone got extremely hot under heavy load, the 8MP ultrawide shooter was disappointing, and the lack of wireless charging was notable for the โฌ1,000 recommended price. If anything, the OnePlus 13 shone a harsh light on the GT7 Pro. Between its versatile cameras, impressive performance, great screen, and premium extras, it was clear that OnePlus had the more well-rounded package. Now, realme is back with the realme GT8 Pro. And it turns out the new phone has a lot in common with the OnePlus 15 . In fact, this seems like the OnePlus 15 from a parallel universe.

body: NASA/Ben Smegelsky NASAโs Crawler-transporter 2 moves toward the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAโs Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Friday, Jan. 9, 2026. The crawler will transport NASAโs SLS (Space Launch System) rocket with the Orion spacecraft to Launch Complex 39B ahead of the Artemis II launch which will journey Commander Reid Wiseman, Pilot Victor Glover, and Mission Specialist Christina Koch from NASA, and Mission Specialist Jeremy Hansen from the CSA (Canadian Space Agency), around the Moon and back to Earth no later than April 2026. The crawler-transporters have carried the load of taking rockets and spacecraft to the launch pad for more than 50 years at NASAโs Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Each the size of a baseball infield and powered by locomotive and large electrical power generator engines, the crawler-transporters stand ready to keep up the work for the next generation of launch vehicles to lift astronauts into space; Crawler-transporter 2 in particular is integral to the Artemis missions. body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Apple is working on end-to-end encryption for RCS in iOS 26.3 Beta 2. However, it appears that only four carriers (all residing outside of the US) have this line of code, and none of them have flipped the switch yet. Shortly after the GSMA announced new Universal Profile 3.0 specifications for RCS last March, Apple committed to adding support for end-to-end encrypted (E2EE) RCS messages in future updates. While that was good to hear, itโs anyoneโs guess as to how far in the future Apple is talking about. We spotted code back in August showing that Apple was testing the same Messaging Layer Security (MLS) encryption in iOS 26 that Google added to Google Messages. But here we are, still waiting for the feature to arrive. However, a new leak suggests that secure cross-platform RCS messaging between iPhones and Androids is another step closer to reality. title: Update your headphones: Fast Pair vulnerability could let attackers track your location

Google says it has โworked with these researchers to fix these vulnerabilities.โ Updates from audio device manufacturers are required to patch the vulnerability. Itโs recommended users update their devices ASAP. The researchers say โmany manufacturers have released patches for their impacted devices,โ but to check with your deviceโs manufacturer to be sure. Thereโs a significant security vulnerability in many manufacturersโ implementation of Googleโs Fast Pair protocol that could affect a wide variety of popular audio accessories. Security researchers at Belgian university KU Leuven have made public information about what theyโve dubbed WhisperPair, a set of cyber attacks that, leveraging a flaw in Fast Pair implementation, can be used to hijack audio devices, letting bad actors potentially track user location or eavesdrop on private conversations.
